intro: Hyacinthella kopet-daghi, commonly known as the Kopet-Dag hyacinth, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia, particularly found in the Kopet-Dag mountain range. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bulbous structure. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, violet-blue flowers during the spring season. Its leaves are strap-shaped and grass-like, growing from the base of the plant. Hyacinthella kopet-daghi is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
